translation.en: [man] The Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum…
was a… art thief's delight.
Everybody talks about the Gardner.
This is… this is it.
The biggest art theft in the history of the world.
translation.ko: 역사상 세계 최대 미술품 도난 사건이 일어난 곳이죠

translation.en: Millions of dollars' worth of artwork.
They disappeared.
Somebody had to know something.
[man 2] Every reporter in this town eventually did something on that heist.
translation.ko: 이 도시의 모든 기자가 이 도난 관련 기사를 썼어요

translation.en: We were all hitting our sources saying, "What's up?"
People didn't seem to know.
translation.ko: 그런데 아는 사람이 없는 것 같았어요

translation.en: [man 3] The crime occurred in 1990 on St. Patty's Day.
translation.ko: 이 사건은 1990년 성 패트릭의 날에 일어났습니다

translation.en: Whatever drunken revelry was occurring across the city, who knows?
translation.ko: 도시 전체가 취해서 흥청거리는데 별일 다 있었겠죠

translation.en: Happy St. Patty's Day.
[man 3] But it was a good time to commit a crime.
[woman 1] With this case,
it is really Boston's biggest unsolved mystery,
in addition to being the largest art heist in the world.
translation.ko: 전 세계 최대 미술품 도난 사건이에요

translation.en: Everybody has a theory.
The people that did it…
maybe they're dead.
Maybe some who were involved are still alive.
When I start to think about the Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum
and the drama and the obsession with getting the paintings back
translation.ko: "낸시 클로허티 보스턴 라틴 스쿨, 1991년 졸업" 그림을 되찾으려는 그 난리와 집착, 광기가 떠올라요

translation.en: and the whole obsession around everything,
translation.ko: 그림을 되찾으려는 그 난리와 집착, 광기가 떠올라요

translation.en: I keep talking about it because it's fascinating to me,
translation.ko: 그 얘기를 계속하죠 제겐 너무 신기한 일이었고

translation.en: because I was there.
[Clougherty] I was a witness.
[Clougherty] That night, I had plans to meet friends.
translation.ko: 그날 밤, 전 친구들을 만날 계획이었어요

translation.en: It was quiet on Palace Road.
The street's very dark…
just lit by this really faint amber glow from the streetlights.
translation.ko: 가로등의 아주 희미한 황색 빛밖에 없었어요

translation.en: We were outside the building and I asked my friend Justin,
translation.ko: 박물관 밖에 있었는데 친구 저스틴에게 그랬죠

translation.en: "Can you give me a piggyback ride?" Jumped on,
translation.ko: '나 좀 업어줄래?' 하면서 냉큼 등에 올라탔고

translation.en: and we started walking down the street.
[Stratman] We're goofing around, we'd had beers,
translation.ko: 맥주도 두어 잔 마셨겠다 장난치면서 가는데

translation.en: and I noticed that this car has its running lights on.
translation.ko: 차에 야간 주행 등이 켜진 걸 봤고

translation.en: We're coming from behind it.
When I get up close to it, I see that there are people in it.
translation.ko: 차 가까이 갔는데 안에 사람들이 보였어요

translation.en: [Clougherty] Two men in the front seats.
translation.ko: 두 남자가 앞 좌석에 타고 있었어요

translation.en: [Stratman] There's a glare from a streetlamp,
but I can see the shoulder of a policeman's uniform.
Boston police uniform, it's got a sort of distinctive keystone shape.
translation.ko: 독특한 쐐기돌 무늬가 있는 보스턴 경찰 제복이었죠

translation.en: [Clougherty] When we saw the officer,
thinking at that time that they had come to end the party,
translation.ko: 파티하는 사람들을 해산하러 온 거겠다 싶어

translation.en: our feeling was, "Let's just go."
I do remember that the car was parked…
translation.ko: 제 기억에 그 차가 주차된 곳은

translation.en: right next to the Gardner Museum.
translation.ko: 이사벨라 스튜어트 가드너 박물관 바로 옆이었어요

translation.en: I probably wouldn't have remembered this night… [chuckles]
translation.ko: 그 후에 그 일이 안 일어났다면

translation.en: …if it hadn't been for what happened later.
translation.ko: 그날 밤을 기억도 못 할 거예요

translation.en: [man 1] The biggest art heist in history.
translation.ko: 역사상 세계 최대 미술품 도난 사건입니다

translation.en: Boston, a quiet museum, a daring robbery.
translation.ko: 보스턴의 조용한 박물관에서 대담한 강도 사건이 발생했습니다

translation.en: [man 2] Vipers are in the grass and are moving towards you.
translation.ko: 위험이 도사리고 있고 시시각각 다가오고 있어요

translation.en: [man 3] The 13 art treasures stolen are worth a half a billion dollars.
Take a look at these composite drawings.
[man 4] I have the paintings with me. Now what?
[man 5] Easy to use as international currency.
[woman 1] Japan.
-[man 2] France. -[man 5] Dublin.
[man 6] Saudi Arabia. I know that's where they went.
[woman 2] These paintings were a get-out-of-jail-free card,
translation.ko: 이 그림들이 감옥 탈출 카드란 사실은

translation.en: and everybody knew it.
[man 7] How are those paintings gonna get people out of prison?
translation.ko: 그 그림들이 어떻게 감옥에서 사람들을 꺼내주죠?

translation.en: What are we talking about this shit for?
[woman 2] Who could carry off something like this?
translation.ko: 누가 이런 짓을 저지를 수 있었을까요?

translation.en: [man 5] Italian mob or Irish mob.
-How you doing? -Good.
[man 4] Everybody is whacked.
[woman 2] There's murders on both sides, it's violent.
translation.ko: 양쪽에서 서로 죽고 죽였고 너무 끔찍했어요

translation.en: -[explosion] -Jesus!
As long as you didn't do anything, you got nothing to worry about.
translation.ko: '네가 잘못한 거 없으면 걱정할 거 하나도 없어'

translation.en: [woman 1] I had no idea what I was going into.
translation.ko: 어떤 일에 휘말리는 건지 저도 몰랐어요

translation.en: It was just horrifying.
[man 8] For now, the empty frames are all that remain on the museum walls.
translation.ko: 현재 박물관 벽엔 빈 액자만 걸려있습니다

translation.en: [Anne Hawley] With works of art,
they're only works of art because you're interacting with them.
I mean, they can't exist without you.
I was the director of the Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum
translation.ko: 제가 이사벨라 스튜어트 가드너 박물관의 관장으로 재직한 게

translation.en: from 1989 to 2016,
and the first woman to be a director.
The museum had become inward-looking.
It hadn't connected deeply to the community.
So, I was brought in
to bring the museum back to life, was sort of my charge.
translation.ko: 박물관을 되살리는 임무를 띠고 오게 된 거죠

translation.en: [Shelley Murphy] I grew up in Dorchester.
translation.ko: "이사벨라 스튜어트 가드너 박물관" 전 도체스터에서 자랐고

translation.en: I went to South Boston High School.
And the first time I went, I fell in love with the place.
translation.ko: 박물관에 처음 갔을 때 바로 사랑에 빠졌어요

translation.en: I had been through all the galleries
and I can remember so vividly The Storm on the Sea of Galilee.
translation.ko: "셸리 머피 보스턴 글로브 기자" '갈릴리 호수의 폭풍'을 생생하게 기억해요

translation.en: Loving that one in particular.
This is gonna make me sound like a wicked snob, and I'm not.
translation.ko: 이런 소리 하면 날 속물이라 생각하겠지만 아니에요

translation.en: It's sort of like the MFA in Boston was like the Louvre,
translation.ko: MFA, 즉 보스턴 미술관은 루브르 박물관 같고

translation.en: and the Gardner Museum was like the d'Orsay.
So pretentious, I can't believe I said it.
translation.ko: 내가 들어도 가식적이네요 안 들은 거로 해요

translation.en: Has more character. Put it that way.
[Hawley] It's such a beautiful environment
that you go to another place.
I like to call it the "a-ha" moment
or the epiphanic moment, which is a little too heady to say.
translation.ko: 뭔가를 깨닫는 순간이라고 하죠 좀 과장되긴 했지만요

translation.en: It's built to echo a Renaissance Venetian palace.
translation.ko: 르네상스 시대의 베네치아풍 궁을 모방해 지은 건물이죠

translation.en: It's very plain on the outside.
You're just shocked when you come inside to this verdant, luscious courtyard
translation.ko: 안으로 들어오면 놀라게 돼요 녹음이 우거진 중정이

translation.en: that is at the center of the museum,
and all the galleries on every floor surround it.
translation.ko: 각 층의 화랑이 그 둘레에 포진해 있어요

translation.en: And then every gallery…
has its own theme.
It's probably one of the most
extraordinary creations by an individual anywhere.
translation.ko: 전 세계 어느 건물과 비교해도 출중해요

translation.en: When Isabella Stewart Gardner built the museum,
she broke ground in 1899.
There was nothing here.
It was a swamp.
And when she died, she left her infamous will.
translation.ko: 그리고 그녀가 죽었을 때 까다로운 유언을 남겼죠

translation.en: She said that if anything were permanently changed,
the collection should be crated, shipped to Paris for auction,
translation.ko: 모든 작품을 상자에 담아 파리로 보내 경매에 부치고

translation.en: and the money should go to Harvard University.
translation.ko: 그 돈은 하버드 대학교에 기증해야 한다고요

translation.en: She was an eccentric in a world where being eccentric
translation.ko: 이사벨라는 괴짜였어요 그때는 여자가 바깥일을 하려면

translation.en: was a way of getting out of the house for women.
translation.ko: 괴짜 같은 면을 활용해야 했던 시대였죠

translation.en: [Vigderman] I believe she was flirtatious.
She didn't mind being a little sexy.
And she dressed to show it off.
Which, you know, wasn't part of the time.
Before the museum was open, she wanted to test the acoustics,
translation.ko: 박물관을 개관하기 전에 이사벨라는 음향을 시험하고 싶었어요

translation.en: but you have to have people in the room listening to the music.
translation.ko: 그러려면 사람들이 그 방에 들어와 음악을 들어야 했는데

translation.en: But she didn't want anybody to see the place.
She was connected to the Perkins School for the Blind…
and she had the blind children come in
and be the bodies listening to the music to test the acoustics.
You know, it's not a museum.
It was her work of art.
It's an architectural spectacle.
[Karen Sangregory] To this day, I still have dreams about the Gardner Museum.
translation.ko: 지금까지도 전 가드너 박물관 꿈을 꿔요

translation.en: All of that stuff really seeped in.
translation.ko: 그 모든 게 제게 스며들어 있어요

translation.en: As a gallery guard, we had all this time to spend
translation.ko: 미술관 경비로 우린 예술 작품을 아주 가까이에서 접할 수 있는 시간이 많았어요

translation.en: intimate time with the collection.
translation.ko: 우린 예술 작품을 아주 가까이에서 접할 수 있는 시간이 많았어요

translation.en: There's no downside to working in a Venetian palace.
translation.ko: 베네치아풍 궁전에서 일하는 데 단점 같은 건 없죠

translation.en: It was just beautiful.
We had the Titian Rape of Europa.
We had the Raphael,
Matisse,
Rembrandt.
And it was just that whole environment.
To feel like you could reach out
and touch something from that long ago.
translation.ko: 그렇게 오래된 작품을 볼 수 있다니요

translation.en: Here I am, staring at the actual marks
translation.ko: 그 화가가 실제 내 나이 때

translation.en: made by the actual hand
of this guy when he was, like, my age.
You just can't get any better than that.
[Aaron Fannin] If you got the call
to work overnight shift, you were happy to do it.
translation.ko: 밤 근무를 하라는 전화를 받으면 기쁜 마음으로 했어요

translation.en: It was kind of a treat.
You were like, "Cool. I get to go stay all night."
translation.ko: '거기서 밤새 있다니 잘됐다' 이런 생각을 해요

translation.en: All the lights in the museum were off,
and you just had your flashlight and a walkie-talkie.
You'd do your round, walk through the museum.
It was pretty spooky.
And then you'd sit at the desk…
and wait for something to happen.
And…
nothing ever happened.
[Heidorn] That's the problem of the night watch.
Day after day, week after week,
year after year of nothing happening.
translation.ko: 몇 년이 지나도 아무 일이 안 생겨요

translation.en: Just absolute benign-- Nothing happening.
And then March 18th, 1990.
[reporter] Today is Sunday, March 18th, 1990. A beautiful day in South Boston.
Now, as the parade gets underway, it's 48 degrees.
We'll see a high of 52 and clear skies.
[Cullen] St. Patrick's Day in Boston,
the day itself,
I'd call it just a drinking day.
People'd be drinking all day,
rolling into Saturday, then right into Sunday.
And Boston has its parade on Sunday.
It's not on the 17th.
The parade in Boston is confined to South Boston.
It draws in hundreds of thousands of people from outlying areas.
Quick march!
The other thing, it would attract an enormous police presence.
But in the area where the museum is,
it's generally quiet.
[Sangregory] It was a total normal day.
Just coming in to work on Sunday morning in my role
translation.ko: 경보 통제 센터에서 전날 야간 근무를 마친

translation.en: to replace the two guys that would've been there all night
translation.ko: 두 경비와 교대해 주고 제 근무를 시작하려고

translation.en: at the alarm control center desk.
Normally, one or both of them would be in there and they would buzz us in.
translation.ko: 보통은 둘 중 하나나 둘 다 있어서 문을 열어주는데

translation.en: Nothing like that was happening.
There was no response, this was completely unprecedented
translation.ko: 아무 대답이 없었는데 전례가 없는 일이었고 이상했어요

translation.en: and very odd.
Too much time is passing.
So, I called the chief of security and told him we couldn't get in.
translation.ko: 그래서 경비 팀장에게 전화해서 건물에 못 들어간다고 했더니 직접 오겠다고 했어요

translation.en: He said, "I'm coming in."
translation.ko: 건물에 못 들어간다고 했더니 직접 오겠다고 했어요

translation.en: He took us around some kind of a back door.
translation.ko: 경비 팀장이 우리를 뒷문 쪽으로 데려갔어요

translation.en: As soon as we got in there,
you just knew something is really, really wrong.
translation.ko: 뭐가 잘못돼도 한참 잘못된 걸 알았어요

translation.en: The security cameras had been turned,
the office door had been busted.
There was a frame in there.
It was like, "Oh."
And there was a crowbar leaning against the wall.
The chief hands me the crowbar.
He's like, "Here, hold this!"
And so I'm holding this crowbar and my mind is thinking,
translation.ko: 그래서 이 쇠지레를 들고 있는데 이런 생각이 들었어요

translation.en: "This is part of the scene of the crime, right?
This is evidence. My hand prints… My hand prints are on this crowbar!"
And then my next thought was,
"He gave me this so that I can pummel someone with it."
translation.ko: '팀장님이 범인을 패라고 이걸 나한테 주신 거구나'

translation.en: It's like I went in with this open vision and curiosity, like,
And then it just, like… [whooshes]
shrunk down really fast.
And then it was like, "Where's the guys? Where's the guys?"
And then the next thought was,
"Are the bad guys still here?"
He picks up the phone and called the Boston police.
translation.ko: 팀장님이 전화기를 들더니 보스턴 경찰에 전화했어요

translation.en: It seemed like all he could say was,
"I'm calling from the Gardner.
[panting] We've got big trouble. We've got big trouble."
[Hawley] Must have been about eight o'clock.
We had some friends come over for breakfast
when I got the phone call from the security director.
And he said,
"There's been a theft and you need to come right now."
translation.ko: '도둑이 든 거 같아요 당장 와 주세요'

translation.en: To me, it felt instantaneous. Like, the street was lined with cars.
translation.ko: 순식간에 차가 거리를 가득 메웠다고 느꼈어요

translation.en: I ended up sitting at the alarm control center.
translation.ko: 그리고 제가 경보 통제 센터에 앉아 있었는데

translation.en: And the police come in, and it was the first order of business
translation.ko: 경찰이 오더니 제일 먼저 한 일이

translation.en: to plop down this big box of donuts on the counter.
translation.ko: 어마어마한 도넛 상자를 카운터에 내려놓은 거였죠

translation.en: Right in front of me. Like, "Whoo!"
[Sangregory] They went up and worked their way down.
No one knows what's going on. We don't know where the guards are yet.
translation.ko: 아무도 뭐가 뭔지 몰랐고 경비들의 행방도 몰랐어요

translation.en: I had never done the rounds like the night guards had,
translation.ko: 전 야간 경비원처럼 순찰을 한 적이 없었지만

translation.en: but I had heard there were tunnels under this building.
translation.ko: 건물 밑에 터널이 있단 얘기는 들은 적 있었어요

translation.en: And I'll never forget
this astonished look on the cop's face, and he says,
translation.ko: 경찰이 놀란 표정으로 이렇게 말한 거였어요

translation.en: "Oh my God.
If there's a body to be found, it'll be in a tunnel."
translation.ko: '누가 죽었다면 시신은 분명히 터널 안에 있을 거야'

translation.en: As it turned out, the guards were located down in the basement.
translation.ko: 나중에 두 경비는 결국 지하실에서 발견됐어요

translation.en: Tied up in the duct tape and everything.
The day of the robbery was the first and last time
translation.ko: 강도가 든 날이 제가 처음이자 마지막으로

translation.en: I was ever at the Gardner Museum.
I was a forensic photographer, and I was also an image analyst for the FBI.
translation.ko: 전 FBI에서 법의학 사진사이자 이미지 분석가로 일했어요

translation.en: I may have gotten there about 9:15 or so.
Those shots there were taken by BPD.
translation.ko: 이 사진은 보스턴 경찰이 찍은 거예요

translation.en: They photographed Rick.
Randy was in the other shot.
But they seemed to concentrate on Rick and how he was taped up.
translation.ko: 하지만 릭을 좀 더 꼼꼼하게 테이프로 감은 거 같더라고요

translation.en: He was duct taped.
His head and his hair in a roundabout fashion.
And then his hands were bound.
Which I thought was kind of odd. They had a little pad.
translation.ko: 좀 이상하다고 생각한 게 패드를 끼웠더라고요

translation.en: Why would you tape around the head?
Why not just put tape on his eyes?
I've seen people who were killed. They were taped.
translation.ko: 전에 살해당한 사람들이 테이프에 감긴 걸 봤는데

translation.en: But Rick's taping, I never saw anything like that.
translation.ko: 릭처럼 감은 건 한 번도 못 봤어요

translation.en: I thought that was kind of odd that he was taped in that fashion.
translation.ko: 그런 식으로 감은 게 이상하다고 생각했어요

translation.en: We were thinking, "Jeez, if these were any real serious hoods,
why not just kill these people?"
Dead men tell no tales.
[man] Wait a minute. Go ahead.
[Hawley] I think I got there around 8:30, maybe,
or quarter to 9:00. I can't remember exactly.
The FBI was there,
and they wouldn't let me in to any of the galleries,
translation.ko: 날 화랑 안으로 안 들여보내 줘서

translation.en: so I had no idea what I was going into.
translation.ko: 어떻게 된 건지 알 수가 없었어요

translation.en: And when I got into the galleries, it was just… -[slams door] -…horrifying.
translation.ko: 나중에 화랑으로 들어가 보니 너무 끔찍했어요

translation.en: -[man 1] How's that? -[man 2] Good.
-[indistinct chatter] -No.
[Green] When I first entered,
I saw the golden frames…
overlapping one another.
And you could see that someone had used a knife.
translation.ko: 누가 칼을 썼다는 걸 알 수 있었어요

translation.en: The paintings weren't unscrewed from the back, they were cut out.
translation.ko: 그림을 뒤에서 꺼낸 게 아니라 칼로 잘라냈더라고요

translation.en: I found that pretty interesting. Why did they cut them?
It wasn't like cutting a piece of paper. As the conservators explained,
translation.ko: 그냥 종이 자르는 거와는 달라요 복원 전문가들 말로는

translation.en: the paintings are not just one canvas.
You can't cut them out and then roll them up like blueprints.
translation.ko: 설계도처럼 잘라서 돌돌 말 수 있는 게 아니라고요

translation.en: They said it'd be time-consuming and difficult cutting these things.
translation.ko: 자르는 건 시간도 걸리고 어렵다고 하더군요

translation.en: [Sangregory] We were starting to hear things, like, "What?
translation.ko: 그 얘기를 듣고 놀랐어요 '뭐? 그림을 그냥 액자에서 잘라냈다고?'

translation.en: They just cut this stuff out of the frames?
[grunts] Oh my gosh."
It was, and it still is, completely unbelievable.
It was incomprehensible to me
that even if you were wanting to steal art that you would treat it that way.
translation.ko: 미술품을 훔친다는 사람이 그런 식으로 작품을 다루다뇨

translation.en: [Hawley] There were 13 works that were taken altogether.
In terms of art historical works,
the most important work lost is the Rembrandt seascape,
translation.ko: 가장 중요한 작품은 렘브란트의 바다 풍경화인

translation.en: Storm on the Sea of Galilee.
It's Rembrandt's only seascape,
and that was brutally cut out of the frame.
As was the Rembrandt portrait of The Lady and Gentleman in Black.
translation.ko: 렘브란트의 초상화 '검은 옷을 입은 신사와 숙녀'도요

translation.en: That was also cut out of the frame,
and that picture had been altered at some time in the past.
translation.ko: 이 작품은 과거 어느 시점에 수정된 흔적이 있어요

translation.en: There was a man and a woman, and a space between them.
translation.ko: 남자와 여자가 있고 둘 사이에 공간이 있는데

translation.en: When they X-rayed it,
there was a child between the man and the woman.
Apparently, the child died, and it was too painful,
translation.ko: 그 아이가 죽었고 그게 너무 고통스러워서

translation.en: and it was painted out by Rembrandt.
The Vermeer picture's called The Concert.
And you have a woman just about to burst into song.
translation.ko: 한 여인이 막 노래를 부르려고 하는데요 "연주회 - 요하네스 페르메이르 1664년, 캔버스에 유화"

translation.en: Vermeer's paintings, there aren't that many.
Some say 33, some say 35.
For me, that Vermeer was
the toughest one to realize, "Boy, that thing is gone."
As a guard,
that was one of my favorite pieces to just study.
You could just be there and you could just almost like talk to it.
translation.ko: 그냥 서서 보기만 해도 말을 걸 수 있을 거 같았어요

translation.en: And then, of course, there was the Flinck,
translation.ko: 플링크 작품도 있었죠 "오벨리스크가 있는 풍경 - 1638년 호버르트 플링크, 오크 패널 유화"

translation.en: Obelisk in the Landscape.
The Chinese beaker.
That actually was the oldest work taken.
Those were the works that were in the Dutch Room,
along with an etching of Rembrandt.
The Rembrandt self-portrait was also off the wall.
translation.ko: 렘브란트 자화상도 벽에 안 걸려 있었어요 "자화상- 렘브란트 판레인 1629년, 유화"

translation.en: And I thought, "Oh my God, that too?"
And I pulled the frame out and the picture was still there.
translation.ko: 그런데 액자를 꺼내니 그림이 그대로 있더군요

translation.en: Then, from the Short Gallery,
there were five works on paper.
Degas depicting jockeys riding horses,
translation.ko: 드가가 말 타는 기수를 "에드가르 드가 - 1850~1880년대 종이에 연필, 잉크, 수채 물감"

translation.en: beautifully drawn and executed.
And then, in that same gallery,
the Napoleonic finial
from the Napoleonic flag.
They kinda theorized that that's where probably they were out of time.
translation.ko: 짐작기로는 범인들이 그때쯤 시간에 쫓긴 거 같았어요

translation.en: Where they tried to unscrew the finial.
The, uh, screws were in the cigarette receptacle.
They hadn't gotten through taking all the screws out,
so they figured it was time to go,
translation.ko: 가야 할 시간이란 걸 깨달은 거죠

translation.en: that these particular items
may have just been an afterthought.
And then finally, from the first floor, the Blue Room,
a Manet called Chez Tortoni.
[Heidorn] There are significant paintings missing.
Ballpark figure on the cost is about $200 million.
[Hawley] The FBI didn't have an art squad. Nobody did.
translation.ko: FBI엔 미술품 전담반이 없었어요 있는 기관이 없었죠

translation.en: It was just devastating.
[reporter] Uh, in terms of the rooms…
[Hawley] So, they were struggling to get up to speed on it.
And, of course, we were shattered.
It was like a death in the family.
translation.ko: 가족 중 누가 죽은 거 같았어요

translation.en: I was just totally numb.
[Arnold Hiatt] We were told by the FBI
we needed to get a reward going before the trail gets cold.
translation.ko: 추적이 어려워지기 전에 보상금을 걸어야 한다고 했어요

translation.en: That was considered to be the most important move we could make.
translation.ko: 그게 우리가 할 수 있는 가장 중요한 조치였어요

translation.en: So, I called someone I knew who was in the Philippines at the time.
translation.ko: 그래서 당시 필리핀에 있던 지인에게 전화했는데

translation.en: He was also the chairman of Sotheby's.
"What do you want from me?" he said.
And I told him we needed a million dollars.
Sotheby's and Christies stepped in,
offering this million-dollar reward.
We were just overcome with calls coming in.
The phone system broke down.
A group of us were just really around the clock
working to get the reward out.
I operate under the assumption that we are going to return--
Get these returned, because we are a world-class museum.
translation.ko: 이곳은 세계적인 박물관이므로 반드시 되찾아야 합니다

translation.en: [Hawley] The press was brutal for a while.
Just brutal.
[reporter] How long have you been director?
For six months.
-[reporter 2] Guards, how old were they? -I don't know.
-How long have they worked for you? -Do you know? I don't know.
translation.ko: 경비들은 얼마나 일했죠? - 알아요? 모르겠습니다 - 몰라요

translation.en: [reporter 3] What happened?
Would you say that the guards screwed up in this thing?
Or were they taken advantage of?
The FBI's handling all of that. We will--
I don't have more to say now,
but we will continually update you if there is any new information.
[Tron Brekke] I was there that morning.
And I think I was maybe the first FBI agent on the scene.
translation.ko: 제가 현장에 도착한 첫 FBI 요원이었던 같아요 "트론 브레케 전직 FBI 보스턴 지국장"

translation.en: Boston PD was already there.
This was designated as a major theft, and I had responsibility
translation.ko: 이건 중절도죄로 간주됐고 저는 강력 범죄 프로그램 책임자로

translation.en: for the violent crimes program, which included
kidnappings, bank robberies, fugitives, that type of thing.
translation.ko: 납치, 은행 강도, 도주범 등의 사건을 담당하고 있었어요

translation.en: As I recall, they showed me the security area…
translation.ko: 제 기억엔 박물관 측에서 피해를 본 보안 구역을

translation.en: that had been breached.
These guys obviously had some idea of what they were doing.
translation.ko: 범인들은 그래도 뭘 좀 아는 사람들 같았어요

translation.en: I had to sit down with the supervisor of the squad
translation.ko: 전 이런 강력 범죄를 다루는 팀의

translation.en: that would handle violent crime like this.
We tried to figure out, "What do we do? Who do we look at?
translation.ko: 뭘 해야 할지 누굴 조사해야 할지 의논했죠

translation.en: Where could these things have gone?"
I only saw the guards briefly upstairs.
There were other people that were interviewing them…
in this conference room.
I could see on the security camera looked like two cops out there.
translation.ko: 감시 카메라로 보니 경찰 둘이 있는 것 같았어요 "전직 경비 리처드 애버스의 음성"

translation.en: They come to the door, they rang the bell,
and they said,
"Boston Police. We got a report of a disturbance on the premises."
translation.ko: '보스턴 경찰입니다, 이곳에서 소란이 있다는 신고를 받아서요'

translation.en: I buzzed them in.
They asked me if I was alone,
and I said that no, my partner was off doing a round.
translation.ko: 아니라고 동료는 지금 순찰 중이라고 했더니

translation.en: They said, "Get him down here."
The cop turned to me and said, "Don't I know you? Don't I recognize you?
translation.ko: 경찰이 절 보더니 그랬어요 '얼굴이 낯이 익은데요'

translation.en: I think there's a warrant out for your arrest.
Can you step out from behind the desk?"
And he said, "Up against the wall."
The guy who was dealing with me was taller and skinny…
translation.ko: 절 상대한 남자는 키가 크고 마른 편이었어요

translation.en: was wearing these gold frame round glasses, if I remember correctly.
translation.ko: "나이: 30대 후반 키: 180, 체격: 마름" 금색 둥근 테 안경을 끼고 있었고 콧수염도 있었는데

translation.en: He had a mustache.
It looked really greasy.
It was probably a fake mustache.
And he handcuffed me.
Cuffed my partner.
Very dramatically said,
"Gentlemen, this is a robbery."
[reporter] The FBI released these pictures
after conversations with guards at the Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum.
translation.ko: 경비들 증언을 토대로 FBI가 용의자 얼굴을 공개했습니다

translation.en: [reporter] Suspect number one is described as a white male in his early 30s,
approximately 5'10" tall, 160 pounds,
dark hair , and wearing gold wire-rim glasses.
translation.ko: 검은색 머리에 금테 안경을 쓰고 있습니다

translation.en: Suspect number two is described as a white male in his early 30s also.
Approximately 6" tall with dark hair.
I don't think the sketches was that reliable.
How long did they see them? Did they get a good look?
translation.ko: 범인을 얼마나 오래 봤는지 제대로 보긴 했는지

translation.en: Were they wearing fake mustaches?
Take a look at these composite drawings.
They may, in a manner of speaking, be worth several hundred million dollars.
translation.ko: 잘하면 수억 달러의 가치가 있을 수도 있습니다

translation.en: If, that is, they bear a striking resemblance
to the two men who inspired them.
[Brekke] With something like this, we try to take a minute,
translation.ko: 이런 상황에서는 한발 물러서서 이렇게 생각하죠

translation.en: step back and say,
"Okay, where do we go from here?"
This is not a crime of opportunity.
These guys were not dressing up for Halloween in policeman's uniforms
translation.ko: 핼러윈이라고 경찰복 입고 재미로 한 짓이 아니에요

translation.en: saying, "Gee, a good idea, let's go rob the Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum."
translation.ko: '좋은 생각이 났어, 이사벨라 스튜어트 가드너 박물관을 털자'

translation.en: You know, this was planned out.
[Robert Fisher] A lot of planning. They had duct tape, handcuffs, uniform on.
translation.ko: 철저히 계획된 범죄였죠 덕트 테이프와 수갑에 경찰복까지 입었어요

translation.en: They were ready to get in.
I've done organized crime cases for years.
I've done wiretaps.
I think I know how criminals think and act.
-I don't think it was a cold call. -[door slams]
You analyze the 13 pieces that were stolen.
It just seemed like they had either cased the place
or given specific information about what to look for,
what's on our shopping list.
A finial off the Napoleonic flag?
[Fisher] It's confounding.
It's hard to figure out why you would, in a museum,
translation.ko: 왜 값을 매길 수 없는 걸작들이 수두룩한 박물관에서

translation.en: with priceless pieces of art,
waste precious time with this finial that is essentially worthless.
translation.ko: 아무 값어치 없는 깃대 장식에 시간을 낭비했는지 이해가 안 가요

translation.en: [Brekke] They had taken a Chinese artifact.
[Fisher] A Chinese ku. It's old, it's somewhat valuable,
translation.ko: 중국제 술잔으로 오래됐고 어느 정도 가치는 있지만

translation.en: but not even close to some of the other items of art just in that room.
translation.ko: 그 방에 있는 다른 미술품과는 비교도 안 되는 수준이죠

translation.en: Was the Chinese artifact a diversion?
There was one self-portrait of Rembrandt where his eyes follow you around the room.
translation.ko: 그리고 렘브란트의 자화상 중에 움직이면 눈이 따라가는 게 있는데

translation.en: They tried to steal that and they took it down off the wall,
and for some reason, it was left behind.
And they don't know if it was just too big or they forgot it.
translation.ko: 너무 커서 그런 건지 깜빡한 건지 모르겠어요

translation.en: [Fisher] One thing that stuck out was the Rembrandt etching.
translation.ko: 또 하나 특이한 건 렘브란트의 동판화였어요

translation.en: It's the size of a postage stamp. The frame isn't much bigger.
translation.ko: 기껏 우표 크기 정도에 액자도 그 정도 크기였는데

translation.en: And yet somebody wasted time unscrewing that
and then taking apart the whole frame
and taking only the etching.
Right, if you're carrying out the biggest heist in history
and you dunno if the police are coming,
and you have limited time to get valuable artwork,
are you gonna waste time with an etching that isn't that expensive,
translation.ko: 별로 비싸지도 않은 동판화에 시간을 낭비한다고요?

translation.en: waste precious moments taking it out of a frame
translation.ko: 그냥 주머니에 넣으면 되는데 시간을 들여 액자에서 뺀다고요?

translation.en: that you could stick in your pocket regardless?
I would say no.
[Brekke] The paintings themselves,
everybody knows about it so you can't sell 'em on the market.
translation.ko: 너무 유명한 그림이라 시장에 팔 수도 없어요

translation.en: At least not on the open market.
Sold, 43 million.
[reporter] Even at a time when prices are setting records,
translation.ko: 미술품 가격이 최고가 기록을 세우고 있지만

translation.en: dealers and curators say these paintings would be difficult to fence.
translation.ko: 딜러와 큐레이터들은 이런 작품은 거래가 힘들다고 합니다

translation.en: Many believe they were hired to steal what they took.
translation.ko: 누가 사주해 훔친 거라고 믿기 때문이죠

translation.en: But unless they had a buyer already lined up,
translation.ko: 구매자가 이미 정해져 있지 않은 한

translation.en: it may have been one of the dumber robberies in recent history.
translation.ko: 근래 역사상 가장 어리석은 강도일 확률이 높죠

translation.en: [reporter 2] Given that these pieces are well-known,
who could possibly keep them?
That's a very good question.
Only probably a person who is determined
translation.ko: 아마 죽을 때까지 혼자서만 보겠다고 결심한 사람이겠죠

translation.en: to keep them private for the rest of their life.
[reporter 1] Some masterpieces are so valuable, they may be too hot to sell.
translation.ko: 일부 작품은 너무 가치가 높아 판매가 어려울 수 있습니다

translation.en: Which raises the question:
were these thieves working for a collector?
translation.ko: 미술품 수집가가 이 범인들을 고용한 걸까요?

translation.en: [Brekke] The Storm on the Sea of Galilee
is the only seascape that Rembrandt ever painted.
Who is gonna have that in their living room?
We started speculating.
"Well, maybe it's a… oligarch in Russia, and he's got it in his basement
and he goes down there and he looks at it."
You know, the only Rembrandt seascape in existence.
A lot of people have speculated that it was a Dr. No theory.
translation.ko: 많은 사람이 '007 살인번호'의 '닥터 노' 가설을 댔어요

translation.en: Some rich oil baron or billionaire wanted these particular items,
translation.ko: 석유 갑부나 거부가 이 특정 그림을 원해서

translation.en: and they paid a crew to carry out the robbery.
[Fisher] It's somebody probably looks like a villain from one of the Bond movies.
translation.ko: 아마 본드 영화에서 나올법한 악당처럼 생겼을 거예요

translation.en: He's sitting there with his cognac
and his trophy wife or girlfriend next to him
translation.ko: 절세 미녀인 부인이나 애인을 곁에 앉히고

translation.en: admiring the art that was stolen from the Gardner.
translation.ko: 가드너 박물관에서 훔친 작품을 감상하는 거죠

translation.en: I was the unwanted child of a German missionary
translation.ko: 난 독일인 선교사와 훌륭한 가문의 중국 여자 사이에서

translation.en: and a Chinese girl of good family.
Any thought that these paintings
are hung on the walls of Mr. Big
translation.ko: 어느 거물의 집 거실에 "딕 엘리스 - 전직 런던 경찰청 미술품과 골동품 전담반"

translation.en: who has them stolen to order
translation.ko: "딕 엘리스 - 전직 런던 경찰청 미술품과 골동품 전담반" 이 그림이 걸려있단 설은 황당무계해요

translation.en: is utter rubbish.
The problem with your Dr. No theory…
is that as soon as he's commissioned it,
and the thieves see there's, in the case of the Gardner Museum,
a reward for information leading to the recovery,
translation.ko: 그림을 돌려주면 보상금을 받는 걸 알았는데

translation.en: what are they gonna do? They're gonna cash in.
They're gonna set the guy up and get their reward.
translation.ko: 사주한 놈을 불고 보상금을 받았을 거예요

translation.en: [chuckles] No. Dr. Nos and so on don't exist.
You get some very professional criminals.
But they don't know how to handle art, what to do with art.
And that's usually their undoing.
Where you've got a professional art thief,
the theft is professional, it's skilled.
The artwork has been taken
because they know how they're gonna dispose of it.
That's when you've got a problem.
My name is Steven George Xiarhos.
I'm the deputy chief of police here in Yarmouth.
Yarmouth is historic, quaint, quiet.
translation.ko: 야머스는 유서 깊고 고풍스럽고 조용한 곳으로

translation.en: And, looking back, a good place to commit a crime.
translation.ko: 지금 생각하니 범죄 저지르기 좋은 곳이네요

translation.en: So, in '88, I get called out to this scene.
Pulling up to this beautiful museum, the Bangs Hallet House,
and seeing the immediate aftermath of a really serious crime.
translation.ko: 즉각 심각한 범죄가 일어난 걸 알았어요

translation.en: They went in the back door, they overpowered the caretaker,
translation.ko: 범인들은 뒷문으로 들어와 직원을 힘으로 제압하고

translation.en: tied her up, taped her mouth shut, her eyes,
translation.ko: 묶은 다음 입과 눈을 테이프로 감고

translation.en: then stole all of these items.
They knew what they were looking for,
they had been inside,
and they were very successful.
And then disappeared.
So you start putting pieces together. You work with local police,
translation.ko: 그래서 추리를 시작했죠 처음엔 지역 경찰

translation.en: and then state police, and then federal.
translation.ko: 다음엔 주 경찰 그다음엔 연방 요원이 개입했어요

translation.en: And through all that, that name came up, this man named Myles Connor.
translation.ko: 수사하는 동안 계속 언급된 한 사람이 마일스 코너란 남자였어요

translation.en: [reporter 1] Myles Connor, a legendary outlaw from Massachusetts.
[reporter 2] In 1975, he stole a Rembrandt from the Museum of Fine Arts.
[man] I first met him, I believe it was in Mattapan Square,
translation.ko: 그 사람을 처음 만난 곳이 매터팬 스퀘어로 기억하는데

translation.en: when he had either a cougar or a mountain lion on a leash.
translation.ko: 목줄을 한 퓨마 한 마리를 데리고 있었어요

translation.en: I said, "That's Myles Connor." And I introduced myself.
translation.ko: 딱 보니 마일스 코너였고 제 소개를 했어요

translation.en: And I followed his career.
And then got to represent him.
Myles was the man.
He could play the guitar and sing.
translation.ko: 기타도 잘 쳤고 노래도 잘 불렀어요

translation.en: And he put on a great show.
He might've been really a big star,
but everything always was interrupted by his other activities.
translation.ko: 항상 범죄에 연루되어 그럴 여력이 없었어요

translation.en: Myles Connor. Yeah. He did a show at the…
-[man] The Beachcomber? -Yeah, exactly that.
My wife in her younger days would go there
with her sisters and a few friends and see his shows.
He was a robber, a thief…
a killer.
[Myles Connor Jr.] Depends upon whom you ask,
but in general, I'm known as an art thief.
translation.ko: 대체적으로 난 미술품 도둑으로 알려져 있어요

translation.en: And some people…
consider me the biggest art thief in this country
translation.ko: "마일스 코너 주니어 미술품 도둑" 미국 최고의 미술품 도둑으로 생각하죠

translation.en: because I've robbed a number of museums.
But then again, I was a rock and roll guy.
[Leppo] Myles Joseph Connor Jr.
His father was a police officer,
his step-brother was a state police officer,
his other brother is a priest.
His favorite line was, "Where did they go wrong?"
He was a criminal.
He was this 5'7", 5'8" guy
with this booming voice.
He was a member of Mensa, he was like, brilliant.
[man] He has a doctor's knowledge of human anatomy,
and is a student of Eastern philosophy.
[Murphty] He was always pulling off crazy capers and getting into trouble.
Anybody in law enforcement that hears my name,
I'm sure must think that I'm running second neck-to-neck to Attila the Hun.
translation.ko: 아마 내가 훈족의 왕 아틸라와 막상막하라 생각할 거예요

translation.en: [Murphy] He robbed museums up in Maine, he had shootouts with police.
translation.ko: 메인에 있는 박물관을 털었고 경찰과 총격전을 벌였어요

translation.en: Myles was shot three, four, five times at once.
translation.ko: 마일스는 한 번에 다섯 발인가 맞았고

translation.en: And went through surgery without anesthesia.
[Murphy] He was the definition, the quintessential art thief.
translation.ko: 그는 미술품 도둑으로는 최고로 인정받았어요 "렘브란트 작품 반환 거래 감옥에서 성사"

translation.en: [Xiarhos] When this crime happened in Yarmouth,
we tried to find him.
One day, I'm in my office and I get a phone call.
"Detective, I heard you were looking for me. My name is Myles Connor."
translation.ko: '형사님, 절 찾고 계신다고요 저 마일스 코너입니다'

translation.en: He said, "Yes, that's my thing,
but I want you to know I had nothing to do with this."
No one really saw anything,
but the cop in me wants to lock him up.
[Connor] Take a peek here if you want to.
One, two, three, four, five, six, seven, eight, nine.
translation.ko: 하나, 둘, 셋, 넷 다섯, 여섯, 일곱 여덟, 아홉

translation.en: No, I think that's wrong. Actually 11 to 12. [laughs]
You lose count.
When the Gardner Museum happened, yeah, we thought back to this.
translation.ko: 가드너 박물관 사건이 일어났을 때 이 사건을 떠올렸어요

translation.en: It wasn't too long after, you know.
Whoever did this, that's their world.
Art theft.
It's not like breaking into a house and stealing a TV.
translation.ko: 집에 몰래 들어가 TV 훔치는 게 아니죠

translation.en: This is different.
Whoever did this and Gardner,
translation.ko: 이 사건 범인과 가드너 사건 범인은

translation.en: in my opinion, may be connected.
translation.ko: 서로 관련이 있다는 게 제 짐작입니다

translation.en: They absolutely have done it before, they probably did it again,
translation.ko: 전에도 해본 솜씨고 이번에도 이들 짓이에요

translation.en: and that's professional thieves.
[man] How many art heists have you done?
[Connor] Probably 30. Thirty-plus.
[man] How many did the authorities know about?
[Connor] Very little.
He was so well-prepared to do something.
translation.ko: 사고 치고 싶어 몸이 근질근질했을 거예요

translation.en: You just don't go into a museum…
and decide to take a painting.
It's the getaway that's the big thing here.
And Myles was a great escape artist.
He had always said, not necessarily to me,
translation.ko: 직접 들은 건 아니지만 항상 이렇게 말했어요

translation.en: that the Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum,
that that was on his bucket list.
Any reasonable person on the planet would assume
that you masterminded it from the beginning.
translation.ko: 선생께서 처음부터 계획한 거로 추정할 텐데요

translation.en: Myles Connor, the biggest art thief in the city.
translation.ko: 마일스 코너는 이 도시 최고의 미술품 절도범이라

translation.en: He would be suspect number one.
If he wasn't in jail at the time that this happened…
translation.ko: 이 사건이 발생했을 때 감옥에 없었다면요

translation.en: On the day of the robbery of the Gardner Museum,
I was in federal custody.
[man] The FBI nailed him in a sting involving art he'd stolen years before.
translation.ko: FBI의 함정 수사로 몇 년 전 도난 사건의 범인으로 체포돼

translation.en: The judge gave him 11 years.
Which means that when the Gardner was hit in 1990,
translation.ko: 그 말은 1990년에 가드너에 강도가 들었을 때

translation.en: the master thief Myles Connor was behind bars.
translation.ko: 대도 마일스 코너는 감옥에 있었단 뜻이 됩니다

translation.en: But there's a saying that the guards came
and knocked on my cell door to make sure I was there.
translation.ko: 내 감방 문을 두드렸다는 얘기가 있는데

translation.en: But I think that's more legend than it is fact.
[Murphy] I think there was a feeling
that somehow this would shake out fairly quickly.
translation.ko: 꽤 빨리 해결될 거라고 예상한 것 같아요

translation.en: And then as time dragged on,
they realized this stuff was just way too hot to handle,
that it was gonna take some time.
translation.ko: 시간이 걸릴 거란 걸 깨달은 거 같아요

translation.en: [Fisher] I started in Public Corruption March of 2010.
My first week was the 20th anniversary.
It was a cold case, it was 20 years old,
so I took time going back through, looking at other angles.
translation.ko: 옛날 사건 파일을 보며 다른 각도로 접근했어요

translation.en: I wanna take this through step by step how it happened.
translation.ko: 사건이 일어난 경위를 하나씩 짚어 보고 싶었어요

translation.en: Not only minute by minute, but second by second.
translation.ko: 분 단위가 아니라 초 단위로 잘게 쪼개서요

translation.en: How did this thing play out?
And how many things had to go right
translation.ko: 얼마나 많은 과정이 실수 없이 완벽해야

translation.en: for these two robbers to still not be caught?
[Murphy] What we know is that 23-year-old Richard Abath,
sort of a music school dropout,
is on duty that night.
Maybe around midnight or so,
Rick Abath takes the first shift to do the rounds upstairs.
translation.ko: 릭 애버스가 위층으로 첫 순찰을 나갔겠죠

translation.en: He says there were fire alarms going off,
and that he ends up shutting off the fire alarm.
He comes down and relieves the other guard at the desk.
translation.ko: 그런 다음 내려와 동료와 교대했다고 했고요

translation.en: But what he does is he opens the outside door
and shuts it about 10 minutes before the thieves show up.
translation.ko: 그런데 릭은 도둑이 들어오기 10분 전에 바깥 출입구를 열었다 닫았어요

translation.en: [Fisher] The first thing we know
is that outside door that they entered through
was open 15, 20 minutes before they enter it.
Why?
[Murphy] So, now at 1:24 a.m.,
two men dressed as police officers show up at the door.
translation.ko: 경찰복을 입은 두 남자가 입구에 나타나요

translation.en: They say they're there to investigate a disturbance.
Rick Abath says he buzzed the door and let them in.
translation.ko: 릭 애버스는 자기가 문을 열어줬다고 했어요

translation.en: They say, "I might have a warrant for your arrest. Step away from the desk."
translation.ko: 그랬더니 '당신 체포 영장을 갖고 왔으니' '책상 앞으로 나와요'라고 했다죠

translation.en: Now he's removed himself from the only place
translation.ko: 이제 릭은 외부에서 도움을 받을 수 있는

translation.en: where he can get help from the outside.
There's a button that will alert Boston Police
that there's a problem at the museum.
And now the thieves spend
81 minutes in the museum, helping themselves.
[Fisher] Ten minutes in a robbery seems like an eternity.
That's what has always stood out for me,
the fact they were comfortable enough
to be in there for 81 minutes.
That's an incredibly long time to spend
when you have people tied up and you don't know if police are coming.
translation.ko: 경비를 묶어놓고 털 정도면 아주 긴 시간이에요

translation.en: [Murphy] Another peculiar thing.
In the Dutch Room, there was a secret panel.
There's a door that leads downstairs, and it was slightly ajar
translation.ko: 거기에 아래층으로 통하는 문이 있거든요 그날 아침 형사들이 도착하니 그 문이 살짝 열려있었어요

translation.en: when the investigators arrived that morning.
translation.ko: 그날 아침 형사들이 도착하니 그 문이 살짝 열려있었어요

translation.en: Which also raised the question,
who'd know there was a door?
[Fisher] There were security cameras,
translation.ko: 그날 밤 감시 카메라는 잘 작동했는데

translation.en: but the thieves knew where the VHS system was,
so they took tape from that evening.
We know that at least one of the proximity detectors went off.
translation.ko: 적어도 근접 탐지기 하나가 울렸단 건 아는데

translation.en: I think the Rembrandt.
If an alarm like that goes off,
typically they get out of there, in case that alerted somebody.
translation.ko: 보통은 누가 올까 봐 얼른 도망치잖아요

translation.en: But these thieves didn't.
I don't see how this was pulled off without inside information.
translation.ko: 내부 도움 없이 도저히 불가능한 일이라 생각해요

translation.en: My understanding is at the guard desk,
there was an old printer there
that prints out the motion detector alarms.
Somebody took that. They took the printout, the paper.
But it was 1990, so they probably didn't realize
translation.ko: 그런데 1990년이라 어딘가에 하드 드라이브가 있단 건

translation.en: that there was a hard drive somewhere… that had the data.
translation.ko: 그런데 1990년이라 어딘가에 하드 드라이브가 있단 건 몰랐을 거예요

translation.en: [Murphy] The most peculiar thing about what happened during those 81 minutes
translation.ko: 그 81분 동안 일어난 일 중 가장 이상한 것은

translation.en: is that most of the stolen artwork was taken from the Dutch Room.
translation.ko: 대부분의 도난품은 네덜란드 전시관에 있던 거란 거죠 "네덜란드 전시관"

translation.en: There were also some items taken from the Short Gallery.
translation.ko: 쇼트 갤러리에서도 몇 점 가져갔고요 "쇼트 갤러리"

translation.en: The Chez Tortoni
is the only piece that was stolen on the first floor,
translation.ko: '토르토니 카페에서'가 1층에 있는 블루 전시관에서 사라진 "블루 전시관"

translation.en: from the Blue Room.
And the only person that the hard drive can show
translation.ko: 하드 드라이브로 확인하니 그 방에 들어온

translation.en: whose steps went into that room…
…were those of Richard Abath…
when he was doing his rounds in the museum.
[Fisher] Best we can tell in the data, they never entered that room.
translation.ko: 데이터로 확인해 보면 범인들은 그 방에 안 들어갔어요

translation.en: So, that means somebody either took it off the wall before…
translation.ko: 그 말은 누가 경찰이 도착하기 전이나 후에

translation.en: or after the police got there.
♪ I know ♪
♪ Something about ♪
♪ Opening windows and doors ♪
I think it happened before the robbery.
♪ I know ♪
♪ How to move quietly ♪
♪ To creep across creaky wooden floors ♪
Number one, you've gotta look at the inner circle.
♪ I know ♪
♪ Where to find precious things ♪
♪ In all your cupboards and drawers ♪
[Murphy] Looking at it through today's lens,
the question is,
"Whoa, why wasn't there immediately a lot of focus on Richard Abath?"
translation.ko: 이런 의문이 들어요 '왜 즉시 리처드 애버스를 조사하지 않았지?'

translation.en: [Abath] Once I sat down with the FBI,
I… I knew.
I was like, "I'm the guy who opened up the door.
They're gonna be looking at me."
